newsitem.title: UK: JD Sports shares rise on market debut.
newsitem.headline: JD Sports shares rise on market debut.

text.p: Shares in John David Sports Plc JD.L, a sportswear retailer, showed a premium of 22-1/2p on their debut on the London Stock Exchange on Tuesday.
The shares traded at 307-1/2p by 1140 GMT, after being placed at 285p by sponsor and financial adviser BZW in an issue valuing the company at 132.6 million stg.
"We are delighted that, after fifteen years of trading, the company has reached this exciting point in its history," said executive chairman John Wardle.
The float raised 8.9 million stg for the company, which plans to expand its chain of 61 stores by 25 in the coming year.
